channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 摘自 @WSJopinion：布赖恩-里尔登写道：CTA 的裁决是美国公民隐私权的巨大胜利，也许是为允许政府收集哪些个人信息设定合理界限的更大斗争中的第一个标志。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The CTA ruling is a huge win for the privacy of American citizens and perhaps the first marker in the larger battle to set reasonable boundaries on what personal information the government is allowed to collect, writes Brian Reardon https://t.co/dSif3A5Jki

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 如果您想了解最优质葡萄酒的内部信息，下次在 Costco 购物时请带上本指南。
item.description:
Take this guide with you the next time you shop at Costco if you want the inside track on the very best wines https://t.co/6L5MFUEgFo https://t.co/6L5MFUEgFo

item.title: 里奇-科恩不在乎影评人怎么说：在黯淡的 20 世纪 70 年代的美国，《洛奇》理应击败《出租车司机》，获得奥斯卡最佳影片奖
item.description:
Rich Cohen doesn't care what the film critics say: In a bleak 1970s America, "Rocky" deserved to beat "Taxi Driver" for the Best Picture Oscar https://t.co/PG522u3jeK https://t.co/PG522u3jeK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 国防部官员说，他们没有发现任何证据表明迄今为止目击到的不明飞行物是外星飞船。他们还得出结论，美国政府并没有掩盖外星人活动的存在。
item.description:
Defense Department officials said they found no evidence that any UFO sightings thus far have been extraterrestrial spacecraft. They also concluded the U.S. government didn’t engage in a coverup to hide the existence of alien activity. https://t.co/ynWKIgIrJ4

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 洪都拉斯前总统胡安-奥兰多-埃尔南德斯因帮助向美国运送 500 多吨可卡因以换取数百万美元贿赂而被判有罪
item.description:
Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernández was found guilty of helping to ship more than 500 tons of cocaine into the U.S. in exchange for millions of dollars in bribes https://t.co/qZaTygK3JL https://t.co/qZaTygK3JL

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 初步调查发现，科罗拉多州一位明星 DNA 科学家多年来一直在篡改证据，数百起刑事案件因此受到质疑
item.description:
A star DNA scientist in Colorado manipulated evidence for years, a preliminary investigation found, calling hundreds of criminal cases into question https://t.co/9b9lzJQVV0 https://t.co/9b9lzJQVV0

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 华尔街因收费而繁荣。@jasonzweigwsj 写道，难怪它要把投资者推向私人资产。
item.description:
Wall Street thrives on fees. No wonder it’s pushing investors into private assets, @jasonzweigwsj writes. https://t.co/B6vZMEGrL5 https://t.co/B6vZMEGrL5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.description:
After 10 years in the making, P&G has developed Tide detergent squares that eliminate water and plastic bottles https://t.co/YG70SAxYUd https://t.co/YG70SAxYUd

item.title: 获得最佳男主角提名的保罗-吉亚玛提（Paul Giamatti）与美国职业棒球大联盟有一段鲜为人知的渊源：他的父亲就是禁止皮特-罗斯参赛的人。
item.description:
Paul Giamatti, who’s nominated for best actor, has a little-known connection to Major League Baseball: His father was the man who banned Pete Rose https://t.co/QbPBswFaLS https://t.co/QbPBswFaLS

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 本周在美属萨摩亚击败拜登总统的默默无闻的总统候选人杰森-帕尔默（Jason Palmer）说，人工智能在他的竞选策略中发挥了重要作用。"他说："我相信我之所以能获胜，部分原因是我非常擅长技术。
item.description:
Jason Palmer, the obscure presidential candidate who beat President Biden in American Samoa this week, says AI played a big role in his campaign strategy. “I believe I won in part because I'm very adept at technology,” he said. https://t.co/85SkN9Ntj3 https://t.co/85SkN9Ntj3

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: @AbigailShrier 写道：如果我们希望孩子们快乐，我们最不应该做的事情就是传达快乐是我们的目标。
item.description:
If we want our kids to be happy, the last thing we should do is to communicate that happiness is the goal, writes @AbigailShrier https://t.co/9ZZcLslhwQ https://t.co/9ZZcLslhwQ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 你很有可能认识一个在日常生活中表现得像拉里-戴维的人。当 "Curb "在25年后落下帷幕时，它的忠实粉丝们说："我身上永远都有拉里的影子。"
item.description:
There’s a pretty, pretty good chance you know someone who acts like Larry David in everyday life. As “Curb” comes to an end after 25 years, devotees say, “I’ll always have a bit of Larry in me.” https://t.co/bZWz0osXZ5 https://t.co/bZWz0osXZ5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 我们的手机、电脑和汽车几乎了解我们的一切。拜伦-陶（Byron Tau）写道，现在，数据经纪人正在向美国执法部门和间谍机构出售这些个人信息。
item.description:
Our phones, computers and cars know almost everything about us. Now data brokers are selling that personal information to U.S. law enforcement and spy agencies, writes Byron Tau. https://t.co/4k0HMNIDlo https://t.co/4k0HMNIDlo

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：Capital One 与 Discover 的交易不仅仅是另一家大银行带来的危险。@ewarren 写道：允许一家巨型银行运行自己的网络来处理数十亿信用卡交易，将创造一个新的华尔街怪物。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The Capital One-Discover deal is about more than the danger posed by another big bank. Allowing a giant bank to run its own network to process billions of credit-card transactions would create a new Wall Street monster, writes @ewarren. https://t.co/xsuJhj8ilx

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 乔治-桑托斯（George Santos）去年被开除出国会，并因涉嫌诈骗政治捐款人而面临刑事指控，他正在发动一场旷日持久的政治复出行动
item.description:
George Santos, who was expelled from Congress last year and faces criminal charges for allegedly scamming political donors, is mounting a long-shot political comeback https://t.co/eeZDhVAuYD https://t.co/eeZDhVAuYD

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他获得了近 9200 万美元的保证金，以担保他欠作家 E. Jean Carroll 的诽谤判决，这为他解决所欠的 5 亿美元民事罚款和损害赔偿扫清了财务障碍。
item.description:
Donald Trump said he secured a nearly $92 million bond to guarantee a defamation judgment he owes to writer E. Jean Carroll, clearing one financial hurdle as he scrambles to address the half-billion dollars he owes in civil penalties and damages https://t.co/m8XwAcnllm

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 哪部电影将获得最佳影片奖？
item.description:
Which movie will win best picture?

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：在克里米亚和其他地方，乌克兰已经证明，只要拥有必要的武器，它就能在对抗俄罗斯方面取得进展。@JillianKayM写道：美国有可能因政治驱动的拖延而浪费这一潜力。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: In Crimea and elsewhere, Ukraine has proved it can make progress against Russia when it has the necessary weapons. The U.S. risks squandering that potential with politically driven delays, writes @JillianKayM. https://t.co/0URUInGXFB

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：进步人士游说美国证券交易委员会，要求上市公司详细披露与气候相关的风险和二氧化碳排放量。加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）答应了。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Progressives have lobbied the SEC to require public companies to make detailed disclosures of their climate-related risks and CO2 emissions. Gary Gensler obliged. https://t.co/1OctiFmv4x

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 在哥伦比亚大学和巴纳德学院，一些师生指责一些教授鼓吹亲巴勒斯坦的偏见
item.description:
At Columbia and Barnard College, a contingent of students and faculty are accusing some professors of advocating a pro-Palestinian bias https://t.co/NalaEf0bek https://t.co/NalaEf0bek

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：拜登的弱点让特朗普将初选（以及即将到来的大选）中的选择简化为一个简单的比较：当时与现在，@KimStrassel 写道
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Biden’s weakness allowed Trump to reduce the choice in the primary (and the coming general election) to a simple comparison: then vs. now, writes @KimStrassel https://t.co/AcwJv66r1Z

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：保守派过去的说法是，精心制定的税法可以促进繁荣。杰里米-亨特（Jeremy Hunt）本周发现了偏离这一主张的危险，@josephsternberg 写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The conservative story used to be that a well-crafted tax code could increase prosperity. Jeremy Hunt this week discovered the perils of drifting away from that pitch, writes @josephsternberg. https://t.co/LW1Epl7gJY

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 1978 年，埃德-明茨看到尼尔-西蒙电影的正面评价。他去看了，但他不喜欢这部电影。之后，他有了一个改变好莱坞的想法。他于上个月去世，享年 83 岁。
item.description:
Back in 1978, Ed Mintz saw a positive review for a Neil Simon movie. He went, and he hated it. Afterward, he had an idea that would change Hollywood.

He died last month at the age of 83. https://t.co/w4BS82B9HL https://t.co/w4BS82B9HL

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 温斯罗普大学（Winthrop University）最近宣布为一对著名的玉米洞球员提供奖学金。@jasongay 谈到了这对大学体育的意义，以及这种休闲后院游戏的竞争性增长。
item.description:
Winthrop University recently announced scholarships for a pair of celebrated cornhole players. @jasongay on what it signals for college sports—and the competitive growth of the casual backyard game. https://t.co/faMPGWKC7R https://t.co/faMPGWKC7R

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 保罗-吉亚玛提（Paul Giamatti）是本周末获得奥斯卡提名的深受喜爱的演员，他与棒球的渊源可能会让你大吃一惊：他的父亲巴特-吉亚玛提（Bart Giamatti）曾担任过五个月的棒球委员会委员。就是他禁止了皮特-罗斯！这就是他们的故事：
item.description:
Paul Giamatti, the beloved actor nominated for an Oscar this weekend, has a connection to baseball that may surprise you: His father, Bart Giamatti, spent five months as commissioner of baseball. He's the one who banned Pete Rose!

This is their story:https://t.co/21JyuWwnWK

— Jared Diamond (@jareddiamond) March 8, 2024

item.title: 最新消息：就业人数再次超出预期。美国上月新增就业岗位27.5万个，但失业率升至3.9%。
item.description:
Breaking: Hiring again blew past expectations. The U.S. added 275,000 jobs last month, though the unemployment rate rose to 3.9%. https://t.co/aeZ6ntHeHl https://t.co/aeZ6ntHeHl

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024
